faulty

Interface Code

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BoolChanAssign, IntChanAssign, ListAssign, VarAssign

    public interface Code
    A simple interface that provides the basic specification of any code, getBDD is the main methods that returns the BDD representation of the Code implemented by Assign, and MultAssign

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      net.sf.javabdd.BDD getBDD()
      Returns the BDD representation of the code
      java.util.LinkedList<Channel> getChannels()
      Returns the channels involved in the code
      java.util.LinkedList<Channel> getChannelsLeft()
      returns a list of the channels appearing on the left of an assignation
      java.util.LinkedList<Channel> getChannelsRight()
      Returns a list of channel appearing at the right of the code (we assume the code is somethign like Var := F)
      java.util.LinkedList<Var> getVars()
      Returns the vars involved in the code
      net.sf.javabdd.BDD skipBDD()
      Returns a BDD representing a skip, useful when some other part of the program is executed
